mass spectra</title>    </titleInfo>    <name type="personal">       <namePart type="family">Khan</namePart>       <namePart type="given">Zia</namePart>       <role>          <roleTerm A.</namePart>       <role>          <roleTerm type="text">author</roleTerm>       </role>    </name>    <name type="personal">       <namePart type="family">Kryglyak</namePart>       <namePart Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics</affiliation>    </name>    <name type="corporate">       <namePart>Columbia University. Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics</namePart>       <role>          <roleTerm type="text">originator</roleTerm>       </role>    </name>    <extension xmlns:rioxxterms="http://docs.rioxx.net/schema/v1.0/rioxxterms/" xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3" xsi:schemaLocation="http://docs.rioxx.net/schema/v1.0/rioxxterms/ http://docs.rioxx.net/schema/v1.0/rioxxterms.xsd">       <rioxxterms:funder/>       <rioxxterms:projectid/>    </extension>    <typeOfResource>text</typeOfResource>    <genre>Articles</genre>    <originInfo>       <dateIssued encoding="w3cdtf" keyDate="yes">2011</dateIssued>    </originInfo>    <language>       <languageTerm type="text">English</languageTerm>    </language>    <abstract>In quantitative mass spectrometry-based proteomics, the metabolic incorporation of a single source of \ufffd⁵N-labeled nitrogen has many advantages over using stable isotope-labeled amino acids. However, the lack of a robust computational framework for analyzing the resulting spectra has impeded wide use of this approach. We have addressed this challenge by introducing a new computational methodology for analyzing \ufffd⁵N spectra in which quantification is integrated with identification. Application of this method to an Escherichia coli growth transition reveals significant improvement in quantification accuracy over previous methods.</abstract>    <subject>       <topic>Molecular biology</topic>    </subject>    <subject>       <topic>Biochemistry</topic>    </subject>    <relatedItem type="host">       <titleInfo>          <title>Genome Biology</title>       </titleInfo>       <part>          <detail type="volume">             <number>12</number>          </detail>          <detail type="issue">             <number>R122</number>          </detail>          <extent unit="page">             </extent>          <date>2011</date>       </part>       <identifier type="doi">10.1186/gb-2011-12-12-r122</identifier>       <identifier type="issn">1465-6906</identifier>    </relatedItem>    <identifier type="CDRS doi">http://dx.doi.org/10.7916/D8V986DS</identifier>    <location>       <physicalLocation authority="marcorg">NNC</physicalLocation>    </location>    <recordInfo>       <recordContentSource authority="marcorg">NNC</recordContentSource>       <recordCreationDate encoding="w3cdtf">2014-09-08 22:50:56 -0400</recordCreationDate>       <recordChangeDate encoding="w3cdtf">2015-02-11 15:38:49 -0500</recordChangeDate>       <recordIdentifier>16520</recordIdentifier>       <languageOfCataloging>          <languageTerm authority="iso639-2b">eng</languageTerm>       </languageOfCataloging>    </recordInfo> </mods>
